lineFollowerSim

Class SpotSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • lineFollowerSim.SpotSensor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LineSensor

    public class SpotSensor
extends java.lang.Object
    Create a spot sensor, no public constructor is defined for this class, LFS method createSpotSensor is used instead.
    Author:
    Ron Grant

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public float read()
        Return spot sensor value averaged over pixels sampled by sensor 0.0 to 1.0. For example if 1/4 sensor pixels on black line and 3/4 pixels on white background value would be 0.25.
        Returns:
        current spot sensor intensity analog range from 0.0 to 1.0

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Set spot rgb color after analysis for sensor overlay display, e.g. setColor(color(255,0,0)); // red

        Parameters:
        color - Specifies integer, suggest using color(r,g,b) or color(r,g,b,alpha) where alpha= transparency

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Retrieve color value set, used by showSensors method.
        Returns:
        color integer

      • getXoff

        public float getXoff()
        Returns:
        spot X offset (inches) from robot center

      • getYoff

        public float getYoff()
        Returns:
        Spot Y offset (inches) from robot center.

      • getSpotWPix

        public int getSpotWPix()
        Get spot width in pixels
        Returns:
        Spot width (pixels)

      • getSpotHPix

        public int getSpotHPix()
        Get spot height in pixels
        Returns:
        Spot height (pixels)

      • setXoff

        public void setXoff(float xoff)
        Set spot sensor center at new xoff position in robot coordinates.
        Parameters:
        xoff - X Distance (inches) from robot center. (Distance forward of center)

      • setYoff

        public void setYoff(float yoff)
        Set spot sensor center at new yoff position in robot coordinates.
        Parameters:
        yoff - Y Distance (inches) from robot center. (Distance to right)

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set sensor name. Note user application may set a default name derived from physical variable name using a facility called reflection. This name may also be overridden here.
        Parameters:
        name - Sensor name

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get sensor name. Note user application may set a default name derived from physical variable name using a facility called reflection.
        Returns:
        Name string.
